Author: Gareth
Comment: Couldn’t you have a “not project time” trac project?

Author: Pip
Comment:
I didn’t think of that.

I’d only thought about one Trac instance per person for non-project time.

Hmm, your idea could work you know.

Author: Henri Bergius
Comment:
The way we’re trying to solve this is to enable multiple different “project extranets” in Trac, or whatever, and then using the [DBE](http://www.digital-ecosystem.org/) peer-to-peer network to actually copy tasks and work reports to our centralized [OpenPsa](http://www.openpsa.org/) install.

This isn’t quite ready yet, but the [first implementation](http://bergie.iki.fi/blog/how-openpsa-uses-dbe.html) is promising.

The good part about this is that if different orgs participate in the same Trac-managed development project, each can get their tasks to their own project management software. Assuming it supports DBE, of course 🙂
